DOC.brief_summary: The investigator develop digital application ( app ) — '' rPlan dual protection '' ( rPlan ) —to use clinic waiting room prior gynecological and/or contraceptive visit . The goal research develop app conduct feasibility , acceptability effectiveness assessment rPlan examine improvement dual method use , enhancement contraceptive adherence continuation , increase condom use decrease sexually transmit infection ( STI ) human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) infection . The research consist baseline activity well 6 week phone call 12 week in-clinic survey STI test , well retrospective chart review .
DOC.brief_title: rPlan Multimedia Dual Protection Intervention Reduce Health Disparities
DOC.detailed_description: Using investigator ' experience digital medium , behavior theory , client-centered intervention , family planning , investigator develop digital application ( `` app '' ) —rPlan—to use clinic waiting room prior gynecological and/or contraceptive visit . The goal research develop app conduct feasibility , acceptability effectiveness assessment rPlan . This study develop rPlan , three-part intervention include precounseling app promotes dual protection , motivational interviewing-informed counseling , concomitant print educational material . The research proceed two phase . In Phase I , investigator assemble 10-member stakeholder advisory team enhance PreCounselor app focus dual protection , train reproductive health counselor motivational interviewing , create concomitant print educational material . In Phase II , feasibility , acceptability , effectiveness intervention assess . The specific aim : Aim 1 : Develop rPlan intervention ( 1 ) enhance pretested PreCounselor app focus dual protection , ( 2 ) train reproductive health counselor , ( 3 ) create concomitant print educational material . Aim 2 : Conduct pre/post feasibility , acceptability , effectiveness assessment rPlan examine improvement dual method use , enhancement contraceptive adherence continuation , increase condom use , decrease STI/HIV infection . The primary outcome dual method use , measure via patient report 6 week 12 week post enrollment . The secondary outcome contraceptive adherence/uptake ( measure 6 12 week post enrollment ) , frequency unprotected penile-vaginal/anal intercourse ( PVI/PAI ) ( measure 6 12 week post enrollment , risk reduction behavior ( measure 6 12 week post enrollment ) , decisional balance/self-efficacy ( measure 12 week post enrollment ) , STI infection ( 12 week post enrollment ) . The research consist baseline activity well 6 week phone call 12 week in-clinic survey STI test , well retrospective chart review capture intercede visit ( e.g. , initial contraceptive method selection , method switching , etc . ) diagnose ( e.g. , pregnancy , STI/HIV ) .
DOC.criteria: African American ( AA ) female sexually active male partner ( ) within past 6 month ; Age 1524 year ; Initiating contraception ; English speak Not currently pregnant intend pregnancy within next 6 month Not currently use implant intrauterine device ( IUD ) .
